Sentencas: A highly conductive bismuth oxide/ceria bilayer electrolyte was developed to reduce solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) operating temperatures.
Titulo: Stable and high conductivity ceria/bismuth oxide bilayer electrolytes for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Bilayer electrolytes were fabricated by depositing a layer of Er0.2Bi0.8O1.5 (ESB) of varying thickness via pulsed laser deposition and dip-coating on a Sm0.2Ce0.8O1.9 (SDC) substrate.
Titulo: Stable and high conductivity ceria/bismuth oxide bilayer electrolytes for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The open-circuit potential (OCP) and ionic transference number (t(i)) of ESB/SDC electrolytes were tested in a fuel cell arrangement as a function of relative thickness, temperature, and PO2 with H-2/H2O and CO/CO2 on the anode side and air on the cathode Side.
Titulo: Stable and high conductivity ceria/bismuth oxide bilayer electrolytes for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These EMF measurements showed a significant increase in OCP and t(i) with the bilayer structure, as compared to the cells with a single SDC electrolyte layer.
Titulo: Stable and high conductivity ceria/bismuth oxide bilayer electrolytes for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Furthermore, improvement in the OCP and t(i) of bilayer SOFCs was observed with increasing relative thickness of the ESB layers.
Titulo: Stable and high conductivity ceria/bismuth oxide bilayer electrolytes for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Hence, the bilayer structure overcomes the limited thermodynamic stability of bismuth oxides and prevents electronic conductivity of ceria-based oxides in reducing atmosphere.
Titulo: Stable and high conductivity ceria/bismuth oxide bilayer electrolytes for lower temperature solid oxide fuel cells
